    Progyny 4 "Smart Cycles" covers IVF, IUI, and egg freezing

    100% coverage for employee. Highly subsidized for family. 25 Lyra mental health sessions.

    Doctors, dentists, and optometrist located onsite

  • Maternity Leave

    6 weeks. Pays up to 70% of an employee's salary for up to six weeks to bond with a newborn, or following placement of a child for adoption or foster care.

  • Military Leave

    Employees may charge 88 hours per fiscal year for military training.

    15 days. 10 hours/m until year 10, then 12 hours/m until year 15, then 14 hours/m until year 20, then 16 hours/m

    6 weeks. Pays up to 70% of an employee's salary for up to six weeks to bond with a newborn, or following placement of a child for adoption or foster care.

  • Sick Time

    130 days. Six weeks is paid at 100%, the remaining 20 weeks will pay at 70% of the employees base salary.

  • Adoption Assistance

    Parental Leave and Baby Bonding Bucks benefits also apply to adoptions. Up to $25,000.

  • Bereavement Leave

  • On-Site Laundry

    Free laundry

  • Remote Work

    Google expects that 60% of its employees will be on-site for a few days a week, with 20% working in new office locations and 20% working from home. Work-from-anywhere: 4 weeks per year. Google also offers opportunities to apply for completely remote work.

  • Surrogacy Assistance

    Reimbursement of up to $40k of surrogacy fees

  • Adoption Assistance

  • Remote Work

    All full-time employees can work from home if their jobs can be done remotely. Employees can request remote work across international borders. Pay is based on location and may be adjusted.

  • Adoption Assistance

  • Housing Stipend

  • On-Site Laundry

  • Remote Work

    Allows employees to work from home freely for less than 50 percent of their working week, or for managers to approve permanent remote work

  • Adoption Assistance

  • Remote Work

    In their newest policy, Amazon will give many tech and corporate workers the option to work up to four weeks fully remote, and can continue working remotely indefinitely, as long as they are able to commute to the office when necessary. The director of your organization can provide additional flexibility. Remote work requires approval at the director level despite marketing dep.

Financial
Financial

  • 401k

    50% match on employee's contribution up to $19500. Google will match up to the greater of (a) 100% of your contributions up to $3,000 or (b) 50% of your contributions up to the IRS limit per calendar year. Every dollar of the match is fully vested

  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

  • Mega Backdoor Roth IRA

  • Roth 401k

  • Student Loan Repayment Plan

    Google will match 100% of your student loan contributions up to a $2,500 annual cap, with those contributions applying towards the principal of your student loan

  • 401k

    100% match on employee's contribution up to $10250. Dollar for dollar match, up to 50% of the IRS limit.

  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

  • Mega Backdoor Roth IRA

    Mega Backdoor Roth 401k: “In plan conversion” up to $28,350 per year after tax.

  • 401k

    50% match on employee's contribution up to $20500. IRS max contribution limit

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

    Allows contributions up to 15% of base salary. 10% discount on purchase price of stock

  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

  • Mega Backdoor Roth IRA

  • Roth 401k

  • Student Loan Repayment Plan

    Microsoft partners with Sofi to offer reduced interest rates with 0.25% discount if employees refinance

  • 401k

    50% match on the first 4% of base salary. Match vests only after 3 years. You can contribute up to 90% of your salary on a pre-tax basis, a Roth 401(k) after-tax basis, or both up to the annual IRS limit.

  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

  • Mega Backdoor Roth IRA

    Up to 90%.

  • Roth 401k

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

  • 401k

    100% match on the first 6% of base salary. 3-6% of base salary depending on seniority; 50% match for <2yrs, 75% for 2-5 yrs, 100% for 5+ yrs

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

    Allows contributions up to 10% of base salary. 15% discount on purchase price of stock. Lookback period of 6 months.

  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

  • Mega Backdoor Roth IRA

  • Roth 401k

  • 401k

    50% match on employee's contribution up to $9750

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

    Allows contributions up to 15% of base salary. 10% discount on purchase price of stock

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

    As an employee, you can convert any amount of your base salary to stock options. Options are priced at 40% of the exercise price. Options can then be used to purchase actual shares of Netflix stock. Your options will expire 10 years after the grant date, regardless of your employment

  • 401k

    100% match on employee's contribution up to $6000. After the current year's annual limit of $6,000 Fidelity matches 50% for the next $500.

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

    Allows contributions up to 15% of base salary. 15% discount on purchase price of stock. Maximum contribution capped at 25K USD. The look-back period: 24 months. Each offering consists of four purchase periods. Shares can be sold right away or held.

  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

    Day Care Flexible Spending Account allows you to put aside up to $5,000 annually in pre-tax dollars to pay for daycare expenses for eligible family members, so that you can work.

    100% match on the first 5% of base salary. Eligible employees have at least three ways to save: before-tax, after-tax, or through a Roth 401(k) option – or all three. After 1 year of service IBM contributes 1% to your account regardless of your savings levels.

Other Insurance
Other Insurance

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

    Coverage for personal accidents with a lump sum of up to 3 times your annual salary, to a maximum of $2,500,000.

  • Dental Insurance

    100% coverage for preventive and diagnostic services and 60% coverage for major benefits.

  • Disability Insurance

    STD (up to 180 days), LTD up to 60% of your monthly earnings (maximum $15,000 per month).

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    $2000 per year contributed by employer

  • Life Insurance

    Basic coverage at 3 times your annual base salary including commissions, to a maximum of $2,500,000. Survivor Income Benefit which provides spouses/partners with 50% of, your income up to 10 years (maximum $12,500 per month) and children up to $1,000 per month.

  • Vision Insurance

    Exams, contacts, lenses and frames are generously covered with low copays.

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

  • Dental Insurance

  • Disability Insurance

  • Life Insurance

    3x Base Salary. Survivor Benefits for Spouse and Child.

  • Vision Insurance

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

  • Dental Insurance

  • Disability Insurance

    LTD with 60% up to $15000

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    $2500 per year contributed by employer. $1,250 contribution in January and $1,250 in July

  • Life Insurance

  • Pet Insurance

  • Vision Insurance

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

  • Dental Insurance

  • Disability Insurance

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    $500 per year contributed by employer

  • Life Insurance

    2x base salary up to $500k payment max

  • Pet Insurance

  • Vision Insurance

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

  • Dental Insurance

  • Disability Insurance

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    $750 per year contributed by employer

  • Life Insurance

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

  • Dental Insurance

    IBM offers two types of dental coverage administered by MetLife.

  • Disability Insurance

    Short-Term Disability Income Plan (up to 26 weeks) and Long-Term Disability Plan (3 coverage options).

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    For a medical plan with HSA: up to $300 in tax-free HSA contributions for self-only coverage or $850 for family coverage in addition to the company contribution ($500 for self-only or $750 for family).

  • Life Insurance

    One times your annual eligible pay, up to a maximum of $1 million. The IBM GLI plan includes a feature that allows terminally ill employees to have access to twenty-five percent (25%) to eighty percent (80%) of their benefits (up to $500,000).

  • Vision Insurance

    IBM offers two options for vision care: the IBM Vision Plan, which provides benefits for eye exams and eyewear, and the free EyeMed Vision Discount Plan, which helps you save money on eyewear purchases.

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

    2x annual salary up to $1m

  • Dental Insurance

    PPO and Premier networks; you will be issued a Delta Dental ID card.

  • Disability Insurance

    STD: salary payments based upon your pre-disability earnings, up to 26 weeks. LTD: up to 60% of your pre-disability annual earnings ($25,000 maximum monthly benefit).

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    $250 per year contributed by employer. The company contributes for Platinum and Gold plans. Platinum: $250 for an individual, $500 for a family; Gold: $150 for an individual, $300 for a family.

  • Life Insurance

    Basic life insurance coverage equal to your annual base salary up to a maximum of $1 million; you may purchase additional coverage.

  • Pet Insurance

    You pay 100% of the cost.

  • Vision Insurance

    This insurance is voluntary and you pay 100% of the cost if you elect coverage.

  • Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance

    1

  • Dental Insurance

    Three dental options to choose from – the Cigna Dental HMO (DHMO) (where available), the MetLife PDP Plus, or the MetLife PDP Plus Premier.

  • Disability Insurance

    Short-Term Disability provides you with income for up to 26 weeks; Long-Term Disability: 60% of your annual base pay

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    The IRS maximum allowable annual HSA contributions for 2020 are $3,550 for single coverage and $7,100 for family coverage. If you are age 55 or older by December 31, 2020, you can contribute an additional annual catch-up contribution of $1,000. In case you or a household member is newly diagnosed with cancer, you can receive $500 contribution

  • Life Insurance

    Basic: 1.5 times your annual base pay. You also have the option to purchase additional Group Universal Life (GUL) Insurance through Minnesota Life.

  • Vision Insurance

    3 plans available.

  • Dental Insurance

    Cigna's Dental PPO plan. 100% coverage for diagnostic and preventive care, 100% coverage for all basic restorative work, 60% for all major restorative work.

  • Disability Insurance

    100% paid short-term and long-term disability plans.

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    $1000 per year contributed by employer

  • Life Insurance

    Annual salary with a maximum of $150,000.

  • Vision Insurance

    100% coverage for annual routine eye examinations and discounts on eyewear.

  • Dental Insurance

    MetLife

  • Disability Insurance

    Short Term Disability (STD) and Long Term Disability (LTD). Non-maternity STD provides 70% of your base pay up to a max of $2,500/week. Maternity or pregnancy-related STD provides 100% of base pay for six weeks, and 70% of base pay for the remainder of your STD disability period. Long Term Disability provides 60% of your base pay up to a max of $10,000 per month, after 26 weeks of disability.

  • Health Savings Account (HSA)

    $600 per year contributed by employer. HSA is offered only with CDHP high-deductible health plan, the company will pay-in $600 for individuals and $1200 for single dependent/family CDHP plans.

    Supplemental (beyond AD&D or Disability) can be purchased, but employee pays all premiums.

  • Dental Insurance

  • Disability Insurance

    Short-Term Disability: There is a waiting period of five working days. Long-Term Disability: After 26 weeks of a qualified short-term disability leave, employees are eligible to apply for Long Term Disability (LTD) Benefits. If approved for LTD, the benefit is 60% of your base salary to a monthly maximum of $15,000. Employees are enrolled in the Long Term Disability Program on the first of the month following 90 days of employment.

  • Donation Match

  • Financial Counseling

    Company-provided financial counseling services are free of charge for MassMutual employees and their spouses or domestic partners.

  • Pension Plan

    The pay credit percentage is based on age and years of service. Employees become fully vested after completing three years of service.

  • Retiree Health Reimbursement Arrangement

    An account is established for employees beginning at age 45 (or upon hire, if already age 45 or older). MassMutual applies a monthly credit of $208.34 (up to $2,500.08 per year) — and interest — to the account.
